A pre-#Omicron analysis by @JohnsHopkins researchers found protection against #COVID19 from the 4 major Western-developed vaccines fell ~21% between 1‚Äì6 months after full vaccination. 

Protection against severe COVID fell by only 10% during the same time. https://t.co/DmjaX4u2ZJ

A newly published research study from @JohnsHopkinsSPH and the @WHO found that COVID-19 vaccines remain effective in protecting against severe symptoms up to six-months after two vaccination doses. https://t.co/d9HEnNmcya

"As we consider the next stage of the pandemic, with hopefully fewer severe infections and perhaps less worry about physical health implications, the mental health consequences of the pandemic‚Äîfor adults and kids‚Äîwill continue," says @LizStuartDC. https://t.co/4LhTq9Ut9c

In the US, 4M+ youth are disconnected from school and work.

These #OpportunityYouth are disproportionately Black, Native, Latinx & rural, an inequity deepened by COVID.

Creating the healthiest nation = creating opportunities for & reconnecting all youth. https://t.co/ikB70sCNTw

The FDA authorized the Pfizer vaccine for children ages 5‚Äì11 in October 2021, on the basis of studies showing a robust immune response, fewer cases of COVID, and minimal side effects in several thousand children.

COVID-19 vaccination uptake in kids 5-11 has been a much slower process than with other age groups. @Rupali_Limaye talks to @SDesmon about why, and a new free course that trains people to be ‚Äúvaccine ambassadors‚Äù who can help do something about it.
